poem:
### The Air is Heavy

Reshuffled dreams,  
drunk on promises  
spilt like stale wine—  
leave a bitter whiff.  
Grownup frowns,  
furrowed with spite,  
dance a weary waltz.  
Incompetence wears  
a familiar coat,  
its seams unraveling  
in the wind.  
Frustration lingers,  
a ghost in corridors  
of hollow governance.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Reshuffle it how you like, Starmer’s ‘grownup’ Labour has the Tory whiff of spiteful incompetence | Nesrine Malik There has been a familiar feeling in the air for a while, but not one I could identify until last week, when it finally settled. It is a sense that this Labour government is just as terminally dysfunctional and directionless as its predecessor. I am beginning to feel the same sense of frustration, confusion, anger and depletion". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
